alert.note: Alert for Greensville (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, southeastern Greensville, central Southampton and southeastern Sussex Counties and the City of Emporia through 630 PM EDT... At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roanoke Rapids, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Emporia, Garysburg, Dahlia, Sussex, Gaston, Homeville, Barley, Claresville, Green Plain, Weldon, Capron, Vicksville, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Lanes Corner, Booker, Yale and Lumberton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
